title: Brian Walshe reportedly stabbed in jail while awaiting murder trial
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Brian Walshe was reportedly stabbed in Norfolk County Jail, where he awaits trial for the alleged murder of his wife.
Walshe was treated at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Boston and has since returned to jail.
He is set to face trial next month for allegedly killing his wife Ana, who disappeared in January 2023.

title: Former Patriots players share drastic measures Bill Belichick would take for team’s trips to Miami
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bill Belichick implemented various travel strategies to combat the Patriots' losing streak in Miami, including early arrivals.
Former Patriots players Brian Hoyer and David Andrews recall staying at multiple Miami hotels hoping to break the losing streak.
Belichick's adjustments couldn't prevent a five-game losing streak in Miami, with their last win occurring 43-0 under Tom Brady.

title: Amid former Celtic Terry Rozier’s gambling investigation, Hornets cancel ‘Sports Betting’ theme night
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Hornets cancel 'Sports Betting Night' after Rozier's gambling investigation emerges.
Terry Rozier is under investigation for alleged gambling irregularities during his NBA career.
Rozier, currently with Miami Heat, has not been found guilty; investigation ongoing.

title: Former Boston Children’s Hospital doctor pleads guilty to child porn charges
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Christopher Sheerer, former Boston Children’s Hospital doctor, pleaded guilty to federal child pornography charges.
Sheerer was charged with distribution, possession, and exploitation of children after an investigation linked him to an encrypted chat group.
Authorities found multiple devices with child sexual abuse material at Sheerer's Boston residence; his sentencing is on Dec. 18.

title: Wu responds to Kraft’s decision to drop out of mayoral race
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu thanked Josh Kraft for his decision to drop out of the mayoral race.
Josh Kraft received 23.07% of the preliminary election vote compared to Wu's 71.84%.
Kraft plans to donate $3 million to local causes instead of continuing his campaign.

title: Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian toured Salem
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian were seen touring Salem, Massachusetts, as part of their northeast trip.
The couple joined a Witch City Walking Tour and visited local landmarks like the Old Town Hall and Bewitched Sculpture.
Despite their fame, they went mostly unnoticed at the Gulu-Gulu Cafe and interacted amicably with locals.

title: Law enforcement source identifies the Charlie Kirk shooting suspect in custody
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old from Utah, is the suspect in Charlie Kirk's assassination at Utah Valley University.
Charlie Kirk was killed by a single shot during a speaking event; authorities call it a targeted political assassination.
Kirk's shooting has sparked bipartisan condemnation amid increasing political violence concerns in the United States.

title: Your new Cape house could be a 245-square-foot cottage in Eastham for $259,000
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A 245-square-foot cottage at 1975 State Highway #3 in Eastham is for sale, listed at $259,000.
Built in 1940, the cottage features one bed, one bath, pine floors, and a rustic ambiance.
It's part of the Cottage Grove association, with a $135 quarterly HOA fee and close to local attractions.

title: A Newburyport teen’s body was unidentified for 33 years. Now, his aunt and a cold-case aficionado want to bring him home.
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: DNA testing identified Anthony Angelli Rea 33 years after his remains were discovered in Newburyport.
Rea went missing from Newbury's Harbor School in 1988; his aunt, Carolann Angelli, sought closure.
Maya Ambrose, interested in cold cases, helped Angelli fund the repatriation and burial of Rea's remains.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com released a news quiz featuring topics like Hasbro, Aroldis Chapman, and local celebrities Matt Damon and Ben Affleck.
The quiz aims to test readers' knowledge of the latest stories affecting the Greater Boston area.
Boston.com editor Peter Chianca oversees the quiz, using AI assistance for question formulation.
